us.phonetic: /ˌɪntɚˈmidiɪt/, (n., adj. in′tər mē′dē it; v. in′tər mē′dē āt′)

example.eg: In the intermediate time, Joe bought some lunch.
example.egtrans: 趁中间有点时间，乔去买了份午餐。

example.eg: Peter passed the test, and was now allowed in the intermediate level class.
example.egtrans: 彼得通过了考试，现在可以参加中等水平课程了。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 中等水平的, 中级水平的

us.phonetic: /ˌɪntɚˈmidiɪt/, (n., adj. in′tər mē′dē it; v. in′tər mē′dē āt′)

example.eg: The intermediate layer of rock was made of coal.
The US diplomat worked as a third party intermediate in the negotiations between the two countries.
The reaction produces radioactive nickel in the intermediate, but decays into iron.
Fred always had to intermediate between his wife and his in-laws.

us.phonetic: /ˌɪntɚˈmidiɪt/, (n., adj. in′tər mē′dē it; v. in′tər mē′dē āt′)

example.eg: I speak French pretty well, but I never got past the intermediate level in Hebrew.

dsense.name: intermediate school
dsense.guideword: US (school for grades 4 -6 or 4 - 8) (指4至8年级)

dsense.name: lower intermediate, lower-intermediate
dsense.guideword: (level, degree: medium to low) (水平、等级、级别)

trans_examp.trans_cn: 中高级的, 中上级的
